Schedule12.OR: Maintains a queue of all system-wide alarms and provides APIs to manage alarms
System Starter, launches ROM-based servers that need to be started at device boot, depending on start-up mode.
Schedule12.OS: Server which allows clients to request that the phone holder authenticates themselves to the phone.
Schedule12.CS: Manages changes to device states, including start-up and shutdown, and changes to system wide properties (using policy plug-ins and command lists)
Schedule12.OR: Manages the system health, including the monitoring of critical processes and their re-launch if they fail
Schedule12.CR: Provide common policy plugins and adaptation plugins for System State Management Architecture
Schedule12.CS: Assorted basic utilities available to frameworks, services, and applications. System utilities (BAFL) including resource file interface and clipboard, system sounds, command-line parsing, descriptor arrays, resource file handling. Used by higher level frameworks and services and available directly to applications.
Authorisation services, including the User Prompt Service (UPS) that allows system servers to generate prompts asking the user to authorise or deny a request from a client application.
Schedule12.OR: Utility library for use by service providers writing policy plug-ins for the UPS
Schedule12.OS: Smart messaging framework and support. In the System Model this is Bio Messaging Framework and Bio Messaging Parsers.
Bluetooth connection and service manager and Bluetooth protocol stack. System Model names are Bluetooth Manager, Bluetooth SDP and Bluetooth Stack PRT.
Schedule12.OR: SMIL Rich Media Parser
C standard library for Symbian OS
Schedule12.OS: Engine implementation for calendar application. This is called Calendar in the System Model.
Schedule12.CR: OMA CP 1.1 compliant protocol implementation. Supports provisioning via WAP Push, Email, OBEX, Removable Media and the SIM.
Schedule12.CS: Central setting database
Schedule12.OR: Certificate and key management framework and APIs
Schedule12.OS: A collection of PC-side tools and libraries for use with Security and Data Privacy
Schedule12.CR: Character set converters. This includes the Character Encoding Conversion Framework.
Schedule12.OR: Character set conversion plug-ins. This includes the Character Encoding Conversion Plug-ins.
Supplies provisioning of network access points, WAP proxies, MMS, OMA DS and OMA DM accounts, POP, IMAP and SMTP email accounts and browser bookmarks.
Configuration settings for Device Management.
Schedule12.CS: Networking and communications configuration information
Schedule12.OR: File logging engine used by comms framework and available to other components.
Schedule12.CS: Framework and utilities to support communications protocols and servers including Comms Root Server, Comms Framework, Network Interface Manager and Comms Buffers.
Schedule12.CR: Comms Server CSY plugin providing serial port emulation over IR, USB, Bluetooth and a virtual serial port.
Schedule12.OR: Network connection agents and agent plug-in interface providing connection to circuit-switched and packet-switched networks. Includes CSD AGT, PSD AGT and Network Controller.
Device side connectivity framework. This includes low level Device Connection Component, Service Framework and Service Providers.
Schedule12.OS: Engine implementation for contacts application. This is called Contacts Model in the System Model.

CS.name: Content Access Framework v2 for DRM

Schedule12.CS: Framework that enables DRM style content management. Note that this is the CAFv2 framework.
Schedule12.OR: Content Access Framework (CAF) support of streaming DRM solutions, such as DVB-H SPP and OMA DRM BCAST.
Schedule12.OS: Framework supporting secure cryptographic tokens (e.g. smart cards)
Symmetric and asymmetric keys, hash algorithms, and pseudorandom number generators. Note this is export restricted
Schedule12.OR: Software plug-in for the Crypto SPI providing symmetric and asymmetric algorithms, hash algorithms, and pseudorandom number generators. Note this is export restricted

Protocols utilities and interfaces for OSI Data Link Layer level protocols. This includes a Link Layer Control group of components: Comms Framework Control and data protocols for Ethernet, PPP, PDP and WiFi, Ethernet Packet Driver and PPP Compression Plug-ins
Abstract interfaces and plugin implementations for a bearer service primarily in the data plane.
Base classes for MIME-type recognizer plug-ins.
Schedule12.OS: Relational database APIs and implementation. This is DBMS in the System Model.
Schedule12.OR: Drivers supporting hardware devices. This includes Ethernet Driver, USB Client Driver, Sound Driver, Speech Driver, Video Driver, MIDI Driver, SD Card*, SDIO* and Other LDDs.
Schedule12.CS: Local (Storage) Media Logical Device Driver
Run Mode Debug API
Kernel Trace Tool
Schedule12.OS: Defines API for EGL
Schedule12.OR: software only implementation of EGL
Fax client and server side API's and protocol stack
Schedule12.CS: Error mapping data used by Error Resolver
Telephony server and client side APIs which includes ETel Server/Core, ETel Multimode, ETel Packet Data and Etel SIM Toolkit
Telephony APIs for 3rd party applications
Schedule12.OR: Specific geographic localisation information providing localisation framework and locale specific strings. System Model name is Locale Support.
Schedule12.CS: API which allows applications to query the presence of optional features and update feature information at run-time.
API which allows applications to query the presence of optional features.
Schedule12.OR: A plug-in framework for converting user data between different MIME-type formats.
Schedule12.CS: Generic file-system server and client-side APIs.
Schedule12.CR: Filesystem plug-in implementations for specific filesystems.
Schedule12.OR: Generic support for code and data storage on Large, Small and OneNand NAND Flash using Unistore2 software.

CS.name: Font and Bitmap Server and Font Store

Schedule12.CS: Font and Bitmap Server and supporting APIs
Schedule12.OR: Free Type vector font rasterizer. System Model name is FreeType Font Rasterizer.
Schedule12.CS: Provides Graphics services and includes Graphics Device Interface (GDI), Colour Palette (PALETTE), Bitmapped Graphic Device Interfaces (BITGDI), Window Server (WSERV).
Schedule12.OS: Provides Graphics Resources and includes Graphics Resource and Direct GDI
Schedule12.OR: Provides Graphics adaptations and includes Graphics Resource Adapter and Direct GDI Adapter
Graphics framework for hardware accelerated 2d composition.
Schedule12.OS: Graphics Surfaces framework and drivers for hardware accessible image data.
Schedule12.CR: Standard plug-ins for customisation of Window Server
Schedule12.OS: Messaging plug-in supporting SMS for GSM send, receive, and edit. This includes the SMS MTM and Scheduled Send MTM components.
Schedule12.CS: Short message service stack for GSM products only and includes SMS PRT, SMS Utilities, GSM Utilities and WAP PRT components.
Schedule12.OR: Provides grid handling suitable for spreadsheet tables.
Schedule12.OS: Interface to query, change or be notified of changes in the status of vibration control, battery and light features.
Schedule12.OR: API to control FM transmitter through the Hardware Resource Manager server.
Schedule12.OS: Engine implementation for context sensitive help application.
Transport framework supporting HTTP protocol
Schedule12.OR: Framework support for Universal Plug and Play
Provides advanced image processing functionality based on Scalado CAPS.
Schedule12.CS: Plug-in framework for software image conversion codecs.
Schedule12.OS: Messaging plug-in modules supporting send, receive and edit internet mail protocols including POP3, IMAP and SMTP.
Schedule12.OR: Utility classes that support standard internet protocols. This includes HTTP Protocol Plug-in, HTTP Filter Plug-ins and HTTP Utilities Library
Schedule12.OS: PRT plugin to ESock Sockets Server, implements IrDA infrared stack.
Schedule12.CS: OS Kernel for low level device start-up.
Schedule12.OR: An LBS architecture supporting integrated GPS/A-GPS hardware and allowing local and network based applications to determine the current location of the device.
Log engine for use by applications called Event Logger in the System Model.
Reference software image conversion codecs. This is included in the Image Conversion Library.
Provides support for rendering video content to graphics surfaces.
Schedule12.OS: Framework and support for email and phone messaging. This includes Message Store and Scheduled Send MTM.
Schedule12.OR: Provides support for reading and writing 3GP, 3G2, and MP4 files
A tuner control for analogue and/or digital radio broadcast channel reception.
Transmitter control and plugins for FM radio and other broadcast radio technologies.
Reference sound device implementation. This is included in Multimedia Framework Plug-ins.
Schedule12.OS: An implementation of the existing DevSound API using a new hardware adaptation layer.
Schedule12.OR: Optional plugins for the Advanced Audio Adaptation Framework. Contains the A3F DevSound Customisation.
MTP sub-system. This includes the framework, the transport plug-ins and the data providers.
This is called Camera Framework in the System Model .
Plugins for the Multimedia Camera API.
Open MAX IL 1.1
Schedule12.CS: Multimedia utility functions
This subsystem comprises a high level framework for manipulating standard media formats This includes Multimedia Framework and MMF Recogniser.
Schedule12.OS: The host process, configurable threading model & management, control & data plane implementations that support the plane specific plug-in components.
Schedule12.OR: Reference Plugins for Multimedia Framework
Schedule12.CS: This subsystem comprises a low level framework for managing media devices of various kinds. This includes the Media Device Framework. Media device drivers can be found in the Device Driver component.
Schedule12.OS: Contains the APIs to allow MDTV middleware to control DVB-H tuner hardware and to receive DVB-H broadcast data.
OBEX protocol implementation supporting IrDA, Bluetooth, and USB. This includes OBEX Protocol .
Schedule12.CS: Implementation of core Posix and Standard 'C' and 'C++' libraries for Symbian OS.
Schedule12.OS: Implementation of industry standard libraries for Symbian OS, intended as a complement to Open Environment Core
Open Source cryptography libraries
Defines APIs for Open GL ES
Defines API for OpenVG
Schedule12.OR: software only implementation of OpenVG
Schedule12.CS: Restart/Shutdown Notification Service
Schedule12.OR: Restricted redistribution PC side connectivity components including SCOM. This is not shown in the System Model.
SIM card phone book synchronisation server and client side APIs
Schedule12.CS: Plug-in server framework and client-side APIs.
Schedule12.OR: Framework for print job setup and control.
Driver library supporting specific printer families and includes some printer drivers.
Protocols, utilities and interfaces for Quality of service at the Physical layer and above. As defined in CDMA, UMTS and IETF standards. This includes PDP, CFP and TFT hook.
Real Time Transfer Protocol and Real Time Control Protocol
Schedule12.CR: Device dependent interface to bitmaps and screen device, not a device driver.
Schedule12.CS: Common utilites for secure IPC
Schedule12.OS: Framework for requesting and receiving information from Sensor Plugins
Schedule12.OR: Abstractions for hardware sensors such as accelerometers, proximity sensors and magnetometers
Schedule12.CS: C32 Server (for devices with serial comms including IrDA) and serial comms APIs
Schedule12.OR: OSI session level Internet protocols utilities and interfaces. This includes FTP Engine and Telnet Engine.
Framework for SIP (Session Initiation Protocol)
Schedule12.CS: Sockets API and control logic for networking. This is called ESock Server in the System Model.
Schedule12.OS: PC tools used to create, sign and analyse the SIS files used to install software via the native installer.
Secure software install for Java MIDlet, JAR, and Symbian SIS file formats.
Schedule12.CS: Enables lifecycle management for software on the device. Provides interfaces for managing and retrieving information about software components
Schedule12.OR: Secure software install for Java MIDlet, JAR, and Symbian SIS file formats. This is not shown in the System Model.
Schedule12.CR: Persistent data storage and data streaming model for applications with supporting APIs.
Schedule12.OS: Implementation of OMA data sync v1.2. This includes Sync Initiation, Data Sync Framework, Data Sync Plugins.
Schedule12.OR: Configuration settings for OMA SyncML Data Synchronisation.
Schedule12.OS: Implementation of OMA Device Management v1.2. This includes Device Management Framework component and Plugins.
Schedule12.CS: Global device status monitor
Schedule12.OR: SQL database functionality for Symbian internal and external applications.
Schedule12.OS: Server providing scheduled application launch
Schedule12.CS: Internet Transport and Network level protocols, utilities and interfaces. Includes IP Hook, Internet Sockets, TCP/IP v4/v6 PRT and DND. Includes IP event notifier, NAPT.
Schedule12.OR: Internet Transport and Network level protocols utilities and interfaces. Includes IP Sec and VPN.
This is DHCP.
Schedule12.CS: Transport layer security delivering SSL 3.0 and TLS 1.0 protocols over IPv4/v6.
Schedule12.CR: Telephony server plugin to integrate Symbian OS with baseband providing support for GPRS and UMTS. This component includes the TSY together with implementations of a connection initiation agent (AGT) and a network interface module (NIF)
Schedule12.OR: APIs for manipulating telephone numbers called Dial in System Model.
Schedule12.OS: Text Formatting and Layout Services.
Schedule12.OR: Support for rendering text in the Devanagari script.
Schedule12.OS: Rich Text Storage and Handling.
Schedule12.OR: Timezone conversion between UTC and Wallclock time. Includes timezone database and compiler.
UI frameworks support for graphical animations
Schedule12.CS: UI Plug-in Frameworks which includes UI App Framework (Uikon, UI Look and Feel, Control Environment and FEP Base), App Architecture, Mime Recogniser Framework, UI Graphics Utilities, and Direct navigational links (DNL) framework.
Schedule12.OS: USB Class support providing control for USB device. This is called USB Manager in the System Model.
Schedule12.CS: User Libraries used by all user-side code and by the kernel, providing fundamental basic services.
Schedule12.OR: Electronic business card and electronic schedule parser (vCard 2.1 and vCalendar 1.0)
WAP message interface to 3rd party stacks
Support for WAP push. This includes the WAP Push Framework, WAP Push MTM and WAP Push Handler.
Part implementation of a WAP stack that supports the messaging functionality.
Animation plug-ins to window server. This is called Clock and BMP Animation in the System Model.
Country and city information database
Schedule12.OS: XML Services provides a collection of XML components providing a XML Parsing Framework with a SAX like API and parser plug-ins for XML and WBXML; a XML Document Object Model API with XPath support; and the Open Source C library Libxml2.
Schedule12.CS: ZIP compression / decompression Library. This is called ZIP Compression Library in the System Model.
Schedule12.OR: USB RNDIS provides IP connectivity over USB

TEST.name: CDMA TSY, Multimode TSY and SIM TSY

REF.name: Board Support Packages
REF.more: (For EKA2 this is the Variants for OMAP H2 and OMAP H4, the Bootstrap, the Emulator Variant, Peripheral Bus Controllers and reference PDDs. Board Support Packages also includes the Text Window Server and User HAL.)

TEST.name: Font and printer file conversion utilities (GDTRAN)
Tools
TEST.more: (excluding non commercial Tools as listed in Schedule 7)
